column2: Job Title:  CFD Engineer (Computational Fluid Dynamics Engineer) Qualifications:  Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Mechanical Engineering (Specialization in Thermal Engineering) Experience: 5 - 8 years Location:  Symphony IT Park, Nanded City, Pune Key Responsibilities & Functions: Develop CFD models to analyze domain-related issues by accurately translating application conditions. Validate results with real-world data, interpret lab-based analysis, and present high-quality engineering reports to the design community, offering practical design suggestions. Support the development of CFD methods related to modern technologies. Mentor junior engineers and assist in enhancing their capabilities. Effective communication and coordination with international clients. Provide support to the sales team for project estimation. Assist the marketing team with creating marketing materials. Required Qualifications: Ensure accurate simulation problem definition. Proficiency in CFD tools such as Ansys Fluent/CFX. Verify appropriateness, adequacy of simulation scope, correctness, and completeness of CFD analysis. Hands-on experience in CFD simulations, particularly on pressure drop, flow analysis, and porous media. Project experience involving Multiphase and species transport analysis. Strong understanding of Heat Transfer and Aerodynamics/fluid dynamics fundamentals. Ability to prepare CFD geometry independently using CAD Tools like Space Claim/Solid Works. Familiarity with experimental characterization techniques is preferred. Strong project management skills. Leadership capabilities to lead a team. Nice to Have Requirements: Exposure to different international standards concerning CFD modeling and testing. Experience in solving solid-fluid interaction problems. Knowledge of Python coding.

column2: Role / Position-CFD Analyst for Under hood thermal, climate control & Aerodynamics simulation Department -Climate control & Aerothermal -CFD Educational Qualification Graduate / Post graduate in Mechanical Engineering Work Experience ~ 3 to 9 Years in Aerothermal / climate control CAE (CFD) Roles and Responsibilities Ensure simulation problem definition, appropriateness, adequacy of simulation scope, correctness & completeness of CFD analysis. Knowledge of handling full vehicle models for Under hood thermal, Exterior aerodynamics & climate control CFD simulations. Interpret CFD results from thermal management, and heat exchangers performance point of view to identify issues and implement / suggest cost effective solutions. Provide accurate and detailed reports of CFD results, providing recommendations & design directions for improvements. Work-out feasible design solutions along with design team to all identified risks. In depth knowledge of CFD simulation process from under hood thermal & External Aerodynamics simulation point of view to meet project timelines. Project Management and Delivery.  Co-ordinate analysis activities on day to day basis with concerned stakeholders Domain Knowledge (Skills Required)- In-depth knowledge of ANSA and Ansys Fluent In depth knowledge of generating mesh for CFD application. 3. Knowledge of different models like MRF modeling, heat exchanger modeling, Turbulence models, and Radiation models in Fluent. 4. Sound knowledge of mechanical and automotive engineering, fluid mechanics, advanced heat transfer, thermodynamics. 5. Knowledge of vehicle thermal systems interactions and architecture, including engine, cooling systems, exhaust systems with strong understanding of vehicle development process. 6. Knowledge of External Aerodynamics for passenger vehicles and shape optimization for drag and lift improvements. 7. Knowledge of climate comfort and Acoustic CFD simulation. 8. In depth knowledge of finite volume methods, turbulence modeling, structured & unstructured grids, wall functions. 9. In-depth knowledge of digital optimization analysis, Ansys Fluent, Tgrid, Ensight, ANSA, Power Flow. 10. Proficiency in MS Office 11. Exposure to PLM is preferred Personal Profile -Independent and self-motivated  Good planning skills with ability for worktime estimate calculation  Organize d, accurate and persistent Good communication, presentation, and negotiation skills

column2: Performs SRAM simulations and supports modeling activities for all GlobalFoundries sites reporting into the Global Memory Solutions team.               ?               Essential Responsibilities               Support of SPICE model generation for transistors of SRAM bit cells in cooperation with the compact modeling team and the respective device owners. This includes the definition of modeling test programs, the extraction of model targets and the verification of the resulting model.              Regular model to hardware correlation for all different SRAM bit cells for all GlobalFoundries technologies.              Parameter simulations for SRAM bit cells and their devices. Definition of measurement specs for in-line characterization and cp/cpk scoring.              Driving the alignment of the SRAM simulation infrastructure across the different GlobalFoundries sites.              High sigma SPICE simulations of SRAM bit cells to determine their yield potential across temperature and voltage. This supports the definition of new SRAM bit cells and the debugging of technology issues.              Customer communication about SRAM models and simulation results.                    Other Responsibilities               Perform all activities in a safe and responsible manner and support all Environmental, Health, Safety & Security requirements, and programs.              Other duties as assigned by manager.              Close cooperation with the other parts of the Global Memory Solutions Team.              Close cooperation with the PDK department as well as the departments responsible for memory array design, IP creation, test and OPC.                    Required Qualifications             Education - Bachelor s, Master s, or PhD in microelectronics, semiconductor physics or related fields ideally with an emphasis on SPICE simulations of MOSFETs, especially for SRAM bit cells.            Experience - BS + 2-4 years of experience or MS + 1-3 year or PhD + 0-1 year              Skills - Proficient in performing SPICE simulations for devices and circuits with Spectre and HSPICE. Excellent understanding of the layout and functionality of SRAM bit cells (single port, dual-port, two-port, etc.). Knowledge about the operation of SRAM memory arrays and components thereof (e.g. sense amp, pre-charge circuit, write-driver). Experience with the characterization of semiconductor devices and SRAM bit cells. Hands-on experience in working in a UNIX environment, particularly with Python and R. Basic knowledge on statistics.              Travel - Select travel for internal workshops and visiting other GF sites.              Fluency in English Language - written & verbal                    Preferred Qualifications           Skills - Experienced user of commercially available high sigma SPICE simulation tools like Solido.        Project management skills - i.e., the ability to innovate and execute on solutions that matter; the ability to navigate ambiguity.          Strong written and verbal communication skills. Excellent presentation skills.          Strong planning & organizational skills.

column2: Responsible for undertaking finite element analysis (FEA) and fluid dynamics (CFD) modelling engineering activities across OE, A/Market and Development. Providing Technical support on tender enquiries.                    Primary duty is to undertake a defined range of engineering integrity analysis in line with all relevant processes and quality requirements.                  You are required to liaise with different departments and disciplines in order to ensure an effective & productive outcome while continually maintaining high quality & standards.                  You will drive engineering design integrity and compliance, quality and safety to maximize customer specification.                  Daily role includes, but not limited to, mechanical design calculations (hand calculations and in-house proprietary programs), computational analysis and associated CAD modelling/modification, interpreting design criteria to apply boundary conditions and interpreting and presenting outputs.                  Provide technical support and direction for manufacture, assembly, supplier and client in relation to product compliance and integrity.                        PRINCIPLE DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES                            Work under the technical guidance of the Chief Engineer, Lead Engineer and/ or Snr Mechanical Engineers and others within Engineering.                            Undertake the full range of Mechanical Engineering Design tasks under supervision including, but not limited to, finite element analysis including: baseplate design analysis, pressure boundary design analysis, and pipework design analysis across a number of different pump types, Modal analysis, Static stress analysis, ASME VIII Calcs, Harmonic analysis, Fatigue analysis, Non-linear analysis.                              Create 3D CFD compatible models from provided drawings or CAD files                          Develops CFD analysis of product design whether new and expansionary, incremental, or for product maintenance                          Prepare presentable deliverables (eg figures, tables, presentations, written reports) for customer                          Analyzes computational research work applicable to product performance.                          Evaluates performance test results and CFD analysis for possible application to development of systems or other uses. Able to perform Pump performance analysis , NPSH analysis, pressure drop in valves etc Be proficient in computer assisted engineering and design software (Fluent and CFX, etc) and equipment to perform engineering and CFD tasks.                          Helping team to achieve project deadlines, delivered with desired quality, cost and efficiency.                          Works to develop functional skills and advanced disciplines of self.                          Help maintain of company standards relating to discipline.                          Assist with standardization of products, process, tools and calculations etc, to reduce time/risk                          KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES                        3D CAE skills required; Solidworks, Ansys Workbench Mechanical, Ansys Space claim                      Demonstrated expertise in Finite Element and Modal analysis at both single component and assembly analysis level. Specific professional experience with Ansys workbench is strongly preferred.                      Ability to read and interpret documents such as integrity and lifting criteria and operating conditions, safety rules, Design concepts/layouts, operating and maintenance instructions and procedure manuals.                      Understands the various turbulence models and their best use cases.                      Understands the difference between steady-state, Multiple Reference Frame and Transient models and their best use cases.Understanding of cavitation with ability on associated modelling. Understands various concepts of multi-physics (gas-liquid interaction, particles, Thermal coupling, fluid/structure interaction                      Must be experienced in computational fluid dynamic simulation software and CFD techniques, including modeling and mesh generation, have experience in validation of simulation with measurements and data post processing, system level hydraulics, heat transfer and thermal simulations and fluid dynamics.                      Familiar with ANSYS (CFX & Fluent), SolidWorks and Inventor, understanding differences between and sensitivity between CAD and CFD models.                        Team working ability and an attitude of collaboration, mentoring and flexibility.                        Ability to write and communicate clearly; Technical writing experience preferred but not required.                        EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE                          BE in Mechanical Engineering with related 2-4 years of professional experience using Ansys Workbench.                          Good interpersonal, communication and influencing skills                          Ability to set and hit personal and team deadlines                          An interest in self-development, Mechanical Technology and Engineering                          An active and valuable team participant who puts team success before individual success
